pageContext.description: Dimension: EL 146.5mm; EWe 63.7; Wbt 21.3; EB fg 24.7; EBst 23.9; Tsep 7.3,Typology: central rib with rounded cast; side flange prominent and extended to blade tips - rounded/pointed crests; rounded septum ends; broad rounded stop crests; flanges probably were leaf-shaped; sides of blade. almost certainly were triple facetted - central broad one; narrow flange crests.,Manufacture: merest hing of cg. flange - very slight crevice; probably had e. bev.; may have come from same mould as 63/1055 (iii) and (iv) despite narrower proportions - sides have been worked evidently,Condition: Blade edge irregular and blunt; butt broken off - in ant.? parts of flange broken.,Archive: PIF and AFI,PRBAF: DF C; SI,Ext.: CI,Rec. SN No. 78,Source: MV
pageContext.surface: Dark coppery brown surface; some restricted areas heavily pocked, other odd pits
pageContext.remarks: Labels/Markings: black ink 63/1055,"Conserved" by area Museum Service Arch. Lab 28/6/68-18/4/69
